Comments_List: I learned about different developmental disorders, disabilities, and dysfunctions. I got hands-on experience working with young adults with autism, and I got to learn more about the history of developmental psychopathology.
the lectures were amazing. I learned so much

Strengths: incredibly low workload, stress free lectures, in-depth discussions with multiple professionals with various specialities, the practicum is amazing
Weaknesses: no continuity between lectures, no clear feedback, disconnect from professors
Strength is the content. Very interesting and great guest speakers. Class could be more organized and structured.
I learned a ton from experts in each field
I would have liked shorter assignments throughout the trajectory of the course. The final term paper at the very end felt overwhelming.
The professors very obviously know what they are talking about and want to engage with students on the topic.

This class was amazing. The professors were so interesting and intelligent while also being incredibly approachable. The guest lectures they brought in almost every to every other lecture were the same way. There was only one final paper but I feel like I learned so much just by listening to experts in the field talk about different aspects of developmental psychopathology. The practicum requirement was also an awesome part of the curriculum that was refreshing to get off campus and rewarding to get to work hands-on with autistic children (where I was placed). This was one of my favorite courses I have taken at Yale. Cannot recommend it enough.

I would recommend this course to another student who has a vague interest in Developmental Psychopathology. I came from an English background, and I was pleasantly surprised with how accessible this course was. I also think working with the special needs students in the practicum program was one of my favorite parts.
I would recommend this course. The volunteer portion was one of my favorite things I have done at Yale and I am incredibly thankful for the opportunity.
